alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 8:53PM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .While temperatures will be much cooler Wednesday, an extremely dry airmass with widespread and long duration single digit relative humidity values will be combined with strong to very strong wind speeds. This will yield critical fire weather conditions areawide below significant snowpack. Strong winds and low relative humidity values will persist on Thursday across northeast New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northwest and West Central Highlands from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...4 to 8 percent Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Highlands
